p: 17. Towards the next section. Our engagement with meaning—our being “in” the world of meaning—is thus reduced to the single model of theoretical knowledge of objects. This constrained view is adopted not only in epistemology but also for practical (i.e., non-theoretical) behavior. It hides the closest and most natural way we are engaged with meaning. In the following section we will discuss the ex-sistential mode of that engagement.
